intro: Cephalophora leguiffei, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a striking flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night, emitting a sweet fragrance to attract nocturnal pollinators. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family and is known for its velvety, hairy leaves and sturdy, woody stems. Its flowers typically bloom in late summer to early autumn, and the plant thrives in well-drained soils with ample sunlight. Due to its unique appearance and nocturnal blooming habit, it is a popular choice for botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
